intro: Rauhia albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered rauhia, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, white petals that contrast with its dark green, glossy leaves. Native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences, adding ornamental value to gardens. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for conservation and study.
